Docs.param: The SPI device used for communication. This Spi device will be displed along with the Ssd1351 device.
The GPIO controller used for communication and controls the the and the If no Gpio controller is passed in then a default one will be created and disposed when Ssd1351 device is disposed.
The id of the GPIO pin used to control the DC line (data/command).
The id of the GPIO pin used to control the /RESET line (data/command).
The size of the SPI buffer. If data larger than the buffer is sent then it is split up into multiple transmissions. The default value is 4096.
True to dispose the Gpio Controller
Docs.summary: Initializes new instance of Ssd1351 device that will communicate using SPI bus. A single-chip CMOS OLED/PLED driver with controller for organic/polymer light emitting diode dot-matrix graphic display system.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Set3rdPreChargePeriod (byte phase3Period = 8);
.method public hidebysig instance void Set3rdPreChargePeriod(unsigned int8 phase3Period) cil managed
Public Sub Set3rdPreChargePeriod (Optional phase3Period As Byte = 8)
member this.Set3rdPreChargePeriod : byte -> unit

Docs.param: Phase 3 period with a range of 1-15. (defaults to 8 DCLKs)
Docs.summary: This double byte command is used to set the phase 3 second pre-charge period. The period of phase 3 is ranged from 1 to 15 DCLK's.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetColumnAddress (byte startColumn = 0, byte endColumn = 127);
.method public hidebysig instance void SetColumnAddress(unsigned int8 startColumn, unsigned int8 endColumn) cil managed
Public Sub SetColumnAddress (Optional startColumn As Byte = 0, Optional endColumn As Byte = 127)
member this.SetColumnAddress : byte * byte -> unit

Docs.param: Column start address with a range of 0-127. (defaults to 0)
Column end address with a range of 0-127. (defaults to 127)
Docs.summary: This triple byte command specifies column start address and end address of the display data RAM. This command also sets the column address pointer to column start address. This pointer is used to define the current read/write column address in graphic display data RAM. If horizontal address increment mode is enabled by command 20h, after finishing read/write one column data, it is incremented automatically to the next column address. Whenever the column address pointer finishes accessing the end column address, it is reset back to start column address and the row address is incremented to the next row. This command is only for horizontal or vertical addressing modes.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetContrastABC (byte colorAContrast = 134, byte colorBContrast = 81, byte colorCContrast = 134);
.method public hidebysig instance void SetContrastABC(unsigned int8 colorAContrast, unsigned int8 colorBContrast, unsigned int8 colorCContrast) cil managed
Public Sub SetContrastABC (Optional colorAContrast As Byte = 134, Optional colorBContrast As Byte = 81, Optional colorCContrast As Byte = 134)
member this.SetContrastABC : byte * byte * byte -> unit

Docs.param: Contrast level for color A. (defaults to 0x86)
Contrast level for color B. (defaults to 0x51)
Contrast level for color C. (defaults to 0x86)
Docs.summary: This command is used to set Contrast Setting of the display. The chip has 256 contrast steps from 00h to FFh. The segment output current ISEG increases linearly with the contrast step, which results in brighter display.

Docs.param: Display clock divide ratio with a range of 0-15. (defaults to 1)
Oscillator frequency with a range of 0-15. (defaults to 13)
Docs.summary: This command sets the divide ratio to generate DCLK (Display Clock) from CLK and programs the oscillator frequency Fosc that is the source of CLK if CLS pin is pulled high.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetDisplayStartLine (byte displayStartLine = 0);
.method public hidebysig instance void SetDisplayStartLine(unsigned int8 displayStartLine) cil managed
Public Sub SetDisplayStartLine (Optional displayStartLine As Byte = 0)
member this.SetDisplayStartLine : byte -> unit

Docs.param: Display start line with a range of 0-127. (defaults to 0)
Docs.summary: This command sets the Display Start Line register to determine starting address of display RAM, by selecting a value from 0 to 127. With value equal to 0, RAM row 0 is mapped to COM0. With value equal to 1, RAM row 1 is mapped to COM0 and so on.

.method public hidebysig instance void SetInverseDisplay() cil managed
Public Sub SetInverseDisplay ()
member this.SetInverseDisplay : unit -> unit

Docs.summary: This command sets the display to be inverse. The gray level of display data are swapped such that GS0 GS63, GS1 GS62

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetMasterContrast (byte masterContrast = 15);
.method public hidebysig instance void SetMasterContrast(unsigned int8 masterContrast) cil managed
Public Sub SetMasterContrast (Optional masterContrast As Byte = 15)
member this.SetMasterContrast : byte -> unit

Docs.param: Master Contrast 0 -> 15.(defaults to 15)
Docs.summary: This double byte command is to control the segment output current by a scaling factor. The chip has 16 master control steps, with the factor ranges from 1 [0000b] to 16 [1111b default]. The smaller the master current value, the dimmer the OLED panel display is set. For example, if original segment output current is 160uA at scale factor = 16, setting scale factor to 8 would reduce the current to 80uA

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetMultiplexRatio (byte multiplexRatio = 127);
.method public hidebysig instance void SetMultiplexRatio(unsigned int8 multiplexRatio) cil managed
Public Sub SetMultiplexRatio (Optional multiplexRatio As Byte = 127)
member this.SetMultiplexRatio : byte -> unit

Docs.param: Multiplex ratio with a range of 15-127. (defaults to 127)
Docs.summary: This command switches the default 63 multiplex mode to any multiplex ratio, ranging from 15 to 127. The output pads COM0-COM127 will be switched to the corresponding COM signal.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetNormalDisplay ();
.method public hidebysig instance void SetNormalDisplay() cil managed
Public Sub SetNormalDisplay ()
member this.SetNormalDisplay : unit -> unit

Docs.summary: This command sets the display to be normal where the display reflects the contents of the RAM..

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetPreChargePeriods (byte phase1Period = 2, byte phase2Period = 8);
.method public hidebysig instance void SetPreChargePeriods(unsigned int8 phase1Period, unsigned int8 phase2Period) cil managed
Public Sub SetPreChargePeriods (Optional phase1Period As Byte = 2, Optional phase2Period As Byte = 8)
member this.SetPreChargePeriods : byte * byte -> unit

Docs.param: Phase 1 period with a range of 2-15. (defaults to 2 x 2 DCLKs)
Phase 2 period with a range of 3-15. (defaults to 8 DCLKs)
Docs.summary: This double byte command sets the length of phase 1 and 2 of segment waveform of the driver. Phase 1: Set the period from 5 to 31 in the unit of 2 DCLKs. A larger capacitance of the OLED pixel may require longer period to discharge the previous data charge completely. Phase 2 (A[7:4]): Set the period from 3 to 15 in the unit of DCLKs. A longer period is needed to charge up a larger capacitance of the OLED pixel to the target voltage.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetPreChargeVoltageLevel (byte prechargeLevel = 23);
.method public hidebysig instance void SetPreChargeVoltageLevel(unsigned int8 prechargeLevel) cil managed
Public Sub SetPreChargeVoltageLevel (Optional prechargeLevel As Byte = 23)
member this.SetPreChargeVoltageLevel : byte -> unit

Docs.param: Pre-charge voltage level with a range of 0-31 that represents 0.20 x Vcc -> 0.60 x Vcc. (defaults to 0.38 x Vcc)
Docs.summary: This double byte command is used to set the pre-charge voltage level. The precharge voltage level ranges from 0.20 x Vcc -> 0.60 x Vcc.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetRowAddress (byte startRow = 0, byte endRow = 127);
.method public hidebysig instance void SetRowAddress(unsigned int8 startRow, unsigned int8 endRow) cil managed
Public Sub SetRowAddress (Optional startRow As Byte = 0, Optional endRow As Byte = 127)
member this.SetRowAddress : byte * byte -> unit

Docs.param: Row start address with a range of 0-127. (defaults to 0)
Row end address with a range of 0-127. (defaults to 127)
Docs.summary: This triple byte command specifies row start address and end address of the display data RAM.This command also sets the row address pointer to row start address.This pointer is used to define the current read/write row address in graphic display data RAM. If vertical address increment mode is enabled by command A0h, after finishing read/write one row data, it is incremented automatically to the next row address. Whenever the row address pointer finishes accessing the end row address, it is reset back to start row address.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetSegmentReMapColorDepth (Iot.Device.Ssd1351.ColorDepth colorDepth = Iot.Device.Ssd1351.ColorDepth.ColourDepth65K, Iot.Device.Ssd1351.CommonSplit commonSplit = Iot.Device.Ssd1351.CommonSplit.OddEven, Iot.Device.Ssd1351.Seg0Common seg0Common = Iot.Device.Ssd1351.Seg0Common.Column0, Iot.Device.Ssd1351.ColorSequence colorSequence = Iot.Device.Ssd1351.ColorSequence.BGR);

.method public hidebysig instance void SetSegmentReMapColorDepth(valuetype Iot.Device.Ssd1351.ColorDepth colorDepth, valuetype Iot.Device.Ssd1351.CommonSplit commonSplit, valuetype Iot.Device.Ssd1351.Seg0Common seg0Common, valuetype Iot.Device.Ssd1351.ColorSequence colorSequence) cil managed

Public Sub SetSegmentReMapColorDepth (Optional colorDepth As ColorDepth = Iot.Device.Ssd1351.ColorDepth.ColourDepth65K, Optional commonSplit As CommonSplit = Iot.Device.Ssd1351.CommonSplit.OddEven, Optional seg0Common As Seg0Common = Iot.Device.Ssd1351.Seg0Common.Column0, Optional colorSequence As ColorSequence = Iot.Device.Ssd1351.ColorSequence.BGR)
member this.SetSegmentReMapColorDepth : Iot.Device.Ssd1351.ColorDepth * Iot.Device.Ssd1351.CommonSplit * Iot.Device.Ssd1351.Seg0Common * Iot.Device.Ssd1351.ColorSequence -> unit

Docs.param: Number of colors displayed. (defaults to 0x65K)
Defines if to split commons odd then even columns. (defaults to odd/even)
Column address 0 is mapped to SEG0 when set to Column0. Column address 127 is mapped to SEG0 when set to Column127. (defaults to Segment0 = Column0)
Colors are ordered R->G->B when set to RGB. Colors are ordered B->G->A when set to BGR. (defaults to BGR)
Docs.summary: This command changes the mapping between the display data column address and the segment driver. It allows flexibility in OLED module design. This command only affects subsequent data input. Data already stored in GDDRAM will have no changes.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetVcomhDeselectLevel (Iot.Device.Ssd1351.VComHDeselectLevel level = Iot.Device.Ssd1351.VComHDeselectLevel.VccX082);

member this.SetVcomhDeselectLevel : Iot.Device.Ssd1351.VComHDeselectLevel -> unit

Docs.param: Vcomh deselect level. (defaults to 0.82 x Vcc)
Docs.summary: This double byte command sets the high voltage level of common pins, VCOMH. The level of VCOMH is programmed with reference to VC.

Docs.summary: This command allows the driver IC to resume from the Lock state. And the driver IC will then respond to the command and memory access.
